title: Show Uncontrolled/Show Controlled
intro: ATUM plugin lets you separate products within the stock central screen as there may be items you no longer wish to monitor, for example, items no longer for sale but still required to keep in the report books. Our team has created two lists of products; one the default is called "Controlled" and the other "Uncontrolled". You can set the product either by editing the product itself or using the ATUM "tool" to edit your whole store in bulk. We have located all ATUM tools within the ATUM Settings - Tools menu.

title: Stock Central Views
intro:
Our team designed filters by the Product Stock Status.
ALL - List of all products within the "Controlled" or "Uncontrolled" filter.
In Stock or Out of Stock - List of all products with at least some or no inventory.
Backorder - List of products you marked as "Allow Backorders" in Woocommerce.

title: Restock Status View
intro:
Restock Status: a feature of ATUM that helps you to know when is the ideal time to place a purchase order. Please, read in detail about how this works here.
https://woocommerce.com/document/managing-products/

title: Unmanaged by WC View
intro: Unmanaged by WC: Feature of Woocommerce that gives you an option to either control the stock of your products at the product level (https://woocommerce.com/document/managing-products/). If you do, the inventory of your product could be monitored, decreased or increased, either manually or automatically via sales, for example. Our team has added two filters to Stock Central, called "Controlled" and the other "Uncontrolled." If you want to activate in bulk the Woocommerce option to control all your products at the product level, please, navigate to the ATUM Menu - Settings - Tools and use the feature we have built for you. Do not forget to take a backup of your store before you do so to avoid any issues and to allow you to revert if something fails.

title: Search feature
intro:
You can use the search feature to search for any products within Stock Central.

To search for products:

  • Select the column you want to search in the dropdown.
  • Enter the product name, SKU, or product ID. All products containing the search text automatically appear.
If you want results to only appear after you press Search, you can turn off auto-search by going to Settings > General and then disabling the Enable Filter Autosearch option. Click Update Settings to activate the changes.

title: Sticky Columns
intro: You can enable the sticky columns by clicking on the Toggle Sticky Columns Icon at the top right of the table.

title: Sticky Header
intro: You can enable the sticky header by clicking on the Toggle Sticky Header Icon at the top right of the table.

title: Bulk Actions
intro:
Using the checkbox located at the start of each row select the products you wish and apply the following bulk actions:

  • Enable WC's Manage Stock

  • Disable WC's Manage Stock

  • Disable ATUM's Stock Control: This action will move the selected products to the Uncontrolled List.

  • Add to Purchase Order

title: Filter by Category
intro: You can filter the Stock Central products by category

title: Filter by Product Type
intro: You can also filter the Stock Central products by product type

title: Filter by Supplier
intro: You can filter the Stock Central products by Supplier

title: Extra Filters
intro: You can filter the Stock Central products by other criterion such as Inbound Stock, Stock on Hold, Reserved Stock, Backorders, Sold Today, Customer Returns, Warehouse Damages, Lost in Post, Best/Worst Sellers and BOM Related.

title: Image column
intro: Product small image preview.

title: ID column
intro: A WooCommerce Product ID is sometimes needed when using shortcodes, widgets, and links. ATUM's stock central page will display the appropriate ID of the product in this column.

title: Product Name column
intro: The first twenty characters of the product name. Hover your mouse over the name to see the full content.

title: Product Type column
intro: This column displays the classification of individual products in WooCommerce. We specify product types by icons with a tooltip on hover. For products with children (variables, grouped, etc), these icons work as a button to expand/collapse their children.

title: SKU column
intro: An SKU, or Stock Keeping Unit, is a code assigned to a product by the store admin to identify the price, product options, and manufacturer of the merchandise. An SKU is used to track inventory in your retail store and must be unique. They are critical in helping you maintain a profitable retail business. We recommend the introduction of SKUs in your store to take full advantage of ATUM's features. You can set the SKU in this column. After you click the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the SKU will update automatically in your store.

title: Supplier column
intro: This is the name of a supplier that supplies the products for your store.

title: Supplier SKU column
intro: The stock-keeping unit code of the product within your supplier's product list must be unique. You can set the Supplier SKU in this column. After you click the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the Supplier SKU will update automatically in your store.

title: Location column
intro: Shows the product's location hierarchy. The grey icon means that there are no locations set and the blue icon means that there. Click the icon to view and edit the locations hierarchy in a popup.

title: Regular Price column
intro: You can configure the product price in this column. After you click the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the product price will update automatically in your store.

title: Sale Price column
intro: You can configure the sale price of your product. Enter the date range for your sale or leave the date empty for a continuous sale price. After clicking the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the change will automatically update your store.

title: Purchase Price column
intro: You can configure the purchase price of the product. After you click the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the product purchase price will update automatically in your store.

title: Gross Profit column
intro: The Gross Profit column displays the difference between the regular price and the purchase price. From ATUM general settings you can choose to display it as a percentage or as a monetary value; but when you hover the value in Stock Central, it will display the non-selected format as well in a tooltip. Also, in ATUM general settings you can set a percentage to the profit margin. We’ll use this value to mark in red all the gross profit values that fall below this margin and in green all the values equal or greater than this margin. If you install our premium add-on Product Levels, the Gross Profit column will be displayed in Manufacturing Central too.

title: Weight column
intro: You can configure the product weight in this column. After you click the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the product weight will be updated automatically in your store.

title: Current Stock column
intro: The current stock represents the number of products available to order (values updated on the Stock Central refresh). If the WC’s manage stock option is enabled, you can set the current stock in this column. After you click the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the current stock will be updated automatically in your store.

title: Out of stock threshold column
intro: When stock quantity reaches the Out of Stock Threshold the stock status will change to 'Out of Stock'. You can set the Out of Stock Threshold in this column. After you click the 'Set' button and 'Save Data', the Out of Stock Threshold will be updated automatically in your store.

title: Inbound Stock column
intro: Inbound stock counter represents the volume of products that have been ordered, using the Purchase Order feature, and are pending delivery.

title: Stock on Hold column
intro: All products within paid orders that are still in the warehouse but not yet shipped (order status processing or on hold).

title: Reserved Stock column
intro: There are times when the store owner needs to reserve or set aside a small or significant amount of stock. Occasions like special events, customer reservations, or quality checks will find this feature very handy. This value is the sum of the total amount of items that are part of pending Inventory Logs with the type set as 'Reserved Stock'.

title: Back Orders column
intro: Every WooCommerce product has an 'Allow Back Orders' option on the product page. It will give customers the opportunity to place an order even when the product is out of stock. The 'Back Orders' indicator will display the number of items required by customers.

title: Sold today column
intro: The value represents the number of products sold during the day. Sold products are items included in 'completed' and 'processing' orders only. Ordered items, but pending payment will show in the 'Stock on Hold' column instead.

title: Customer Returns column
intro: We don't think there is a store owner that wants to see products returning to the warehouse. However, in case there is an item coming back from the customer store owner can use the Inventory Logs to create a log entry with the 'Customer Returns' type. This value is the sum of the total amount of items that are part of pending Inventory Logs with the type set as 'Customer Returns'.

title: Warehouse Damages column
intro: In the unlikely event of warehouse or in-house damages, the Inventory Logs have the option to create an entry with the 'Warehouse Damage' type. This value is the sum of the total amount of items that are part of pending Inventory Logs with the type set as 'Warehouse Damage'.

title: Lost in Post column
intro: Inventory Logs add-on can create a log entry under the 'Lost in Post' tab within the 'Inventory Log' menu for all items that have gone missing on the route to the customer. This indicator helps to control the performance of postal carriers as well as the work of dispatch departments.

title: Other Logs column
intro: Within the Inventory Log tab you can create a log with the ‘Other’ type in cases when the log doesn’t match with ‘Customer Returns’, ‘Warehouse Damages’, or ‘Lost in Post’ options.

title: Sales Last Days column
intro: Users will value this performance indicator as a tool that allows them to see the actual sales of the product within the last X days (sold products are items included in 'completed' and 'processing' orders only. Ordered items, but pending payment will show in the 'Stock on Hold' column instead). You can change the number of days by simply clicking on its blue number.

title: Stock will Last (Days) column
intro: A feature that will tell the user the average amount of days that a product will keep 'in stock' status. By default, we base this indicator on sales for the past seven days (we do not include the current day sales).

title: Out of Stock for (Days) column
intro: This indicator shows the number of days an item has the 'Out of Stock' status. Store owners can more accurately monitor the effectiveness of their ordering. Please, note that ATUM will only calculate products that go out of stock after the initial plugin install.

title: Lost Sales column
intro: Our users will want to see this figure as close to zero as possible. The formula calculates the volume of products that the store owner would sell if the item stayed in stock. By default, we take the average sales for the last seven days the item was in stock. We time the result by the number of days the item is out of stock.

title: Stock Central Screen Options
intro:
ATUM Stock Central allows you to hide columns you do need. This feature is handy as it will remove unnecessary clatter and improve your workflow. Click the "Screen Options" menu, and select/deselect the relevant column names.

You can as well amend the number of products you see per page. If your shop is large with a long history, it may be helpful for you to decrease the number of products to reduce the processed data.

title: Export Data
intro:
The Export Data feature allows you to export selected data from Stock Central as a pre-formatted .pdf file.

To export data as a .pdf:

  • From Stock Central, click Export Data.
  • In the Columns section, enable the columns you want to be included in the export.
  • Use the Product Type menu if you want to only include a specific product type.
  • Use the Product Category menu if you want to only include a specific product category.
  • Enter the maximum width of the product names displayed in the report in the Title Max Length field.
